intro: Pouteria fragrans, commonly known as the sweet-scented pouteria, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, glossy leaves and fragrant, yellow flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are often used in local cuisines. Its ornamental value is due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms. Pouteria fragrans is also valued for its potential medicinal properties.
